3sc 3dc 3sc 2dc 4sc r single_crochet b b 22 b 2sc double_crochet 4sc double_crochet 3sc double_crochet 4sc double_crochet 3sc r single_crochet b repeat from row 4 squeezebox ©2023 designed by ad whited designs ravelry com or etsy com 3 squeezebox color a = background color squeezebox ©2023 designed by ad whited designs ravelry com or etsy com 4 squeezebox how to do an invisible join when working in the round as we do for an envelope border when you come to the joining point open up the loop that s on the hook remove the hook put your working yarn behind your project with your hook above the working yarn put the hook through the top loops of the first stitch of the round from the back to the front and pick up the dropped loop pull the working yarn to close the loop around the hook and then pull through the stitch from front to back envelope border this is how i make a basic envelope border i do not start at a corner i start at the center of the bottom i do invisible joins at the end of rounds and only cut when i change colors i do not carry colors up because the ends will be enclosed in the envelope border so i cut and secure work these instructions for both sides cut and change colors after joining if you like for extra decoration step 1 with the back side of your blanket facing you find the center of the bottom of your blanket this will be the foundation row that began your project mark the back loop for later work a standing flsc in that stitch you can work this entire back side of the envelope border in one color or if you prefer to do more colors that is up to you step 2
